page.title: 17The Houses We Live In.
page.content: There are lots of large Victorian houses in the southern area of our block. They used to be owned by owners of steel works,but today they are used as normal houses,although some of the larger houses are used as offices. Of the remaining housing, most are semi-detached with a very few terraced houses. There are quite a few blocks of flats, which are mostly occupied by old people. The upper part of Graham Road has two blocks on it, and there are two blocks at the bottom of Slayleigh Lane. On Nether Green Road, there is some sheltered accommodation. There are about twenty flats in this unit, and there is a warden to keep an eye on them. This is an established residential area,many houses having been built before the Second World War. However there has been some new building taking place,especially on
